case_vignette: A previously healthy 46-year-old man comes to the physician for an 8-month history of headache that is more severe in the mornings. His blood pressure is 151/92 mm Hg. Examination shows enlargement of the nose, forehead, and jaw as well as the hands, fingers, and feet. Ophthalmologic examination shows impaired vision in the outer peripheral fields of both eyes. Laboratory studies show a serum glucose concentration of 225 mg/dL.
question: Which  findings is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_mcq: Elevated serum insulin-like growth factor-1 level
trial_0.vignette_frq: Elevated serum insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1) levels and abnormal growth hormone suppression test.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Endocrinology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having headaches that are worse in the mornings, and I've noticed some changes in my vision where I can't see well on the outer sides.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For about 8 months.
Have you noticed any changes in your sense of smell or had any unexplained milk production?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in my sense of smell or unexplained milk production.
Do you have any history of hormonal imbalances or tumors in your family?
I don't have any knowledge of hormonal imbalances or tumors in my family history.
Have you experienced any recent growth in your hands, feet, or facial features, or changes in your body hair distribution?
Yes, I have noticed enlargement of my nose, forehead, jaw, hands, fingers, and feet.
Final Diagnosis: Acromegaly.

trial_0.multiturn_mcq: Final Diagnosis: Elevated serum insulin-like growth factor-1 level
trial_0.summarized_conversation: The patient has been experiencing worsening headaches in the mornings along with vision changes, specifically decreased peripheral vision, for about 8 months. The patient reports no changes in sense of smell or unexplained milk production. There is no known family history of hormonal imbalances or tumors. The patient has noted enlargement of the nose, forehead, jaw, hands, fingers, and feet.
trial_0.summarized_mcq: Elevated serum insulin-like growth factor-1 level
trial_0.summarized_frq: Elevated growth hormone (GH) levels and abnormal glucose tolerance test.
